comment: Dr. Tsui is an awesome professor, definitely one of my all-time favorites.  His lectures are thought provoking and are loaded with very useful real-world knowledge.  I took his Intro to SWE course, and, as he said, this course has much more breadth than depth. I felt the (2)  group projects markedly improved my skill and industry-readiness.

Tsui is a tough grader. There are only 4 grades in his Software engineering class, and the midterm and final were each worth a third of your grade. He also doesn't give a study guide, but you can pass if you pay attention and study the power points. His lectures are interesting, though, and he is really passionate about what he teaches.

He is the best professor for software engineering and maybe in the whole university. He is tough but you will learn a lot and you do not need the text book. He was even author of a text book and did not the require the book.

This teacher is really hard. His midterm and final are worth about 75% of your grade. He grades based on your rank in the class. The top few get A's, the next group gets B's, most get C's, and others get D's and F's. So it is really unfair. My advice is to study his powerpoints to death and with that, you will be okay.

Amazing professor overall. I had no idea of taking research path to complete my degree requirements. He has been influential in making me to do so and my paper has been accepted in an highly accredited international conference
One of my top profs at SPSU. Great man, great teacher. You will not get his kind of experienced, no-bull clarity on the subject of Software Engineering anywhere else.

He is an awesome professor. He is the best professor so far at SPSU. Look his background at his own website and you will know what I'm talking about.  PHD from GAtech. Vice President of Famouse software comapnies and more

I have no clue why Dr. Tsui doesn't have more good ratings because he is easily one of the best professors at SPSU.  This man has such a wealth of knowledge about the Software Engineering world, it's ridiculous.  You are guaranteed to learn in his class and everything he teaches is useful and relevant. Welcomes feedback and input from his students.
Very helpful, lots of power point, discussions based class, refers to the outside of the class a lot.
